page.title: 15THE IMPS, LINCOLN.
page.content: {Lincoln City}football team,{the Imps, was formed in{1883}but little is known about them until{1892 }when they were in 9th position in {Division 2.}Now they are in {Division 3}and play in a red and white strip. Their ground is called {Sincil Bank.}The stands are St.Andrews and South Park and with the terraces hold {15,000 }people. On our visit we entered by the player's tunnel onto the pitch, saw the Board Room and Press Box, and visited the changing room which had a board to plan the moves for the game. We saw the boot room where the player's boots are looked after by the apprentices. In the physiotherapy room were two players having treatment from Bert Loxley, the physiotherapist. The captain told us a {new football}was used for {each game }and cost around {Â£100.
